title: Stacks & Queues
concept: This level teaches implementation and problem-solving using stacks and queues — push/pop/top operations, balanced parentheses, reversing, min-stack logic, queue operations, circular queue simulation and queue-based problems.

challenges.title: Implement Stack
challenges.description: Perform push/pop/top operations on stack based on given commands and print final stack (top to bottom). If pop on empty → ignore.

challenges.title: Balanced Parentheses
challenges.description: Given string of brackets (), {}, [], print Yes if balanced else No.
challenges.starterCode: // push opening and pop on matching closing

challenges.title: Next Greater Element
challenges.description: For each element in array print next greater element on right, else -1. Use stack (traverse from right).

challenges.title: Min Stack
challenges.description: For push/pop commands maintain stack and also print minimum element after each operation. If empty print -1.

challenges.title: Reverse String Using Stack
challenges.description: Using stack only, reverse the given string.
challenges.starterCode: // push all chars then pop to build reverse

challenges.title: Implement Queue
challenges.description: Perform enqueue/dequeue/front operations. On dequeue if empty ignore. On front if empty print -1.

challenges.title: Circular Queue Simulation
challenges.description: Given size N and Q queries (ENQ X / DEQ), simulate circular queue and print final elements from front to rear.

challenges.title: First Non-Repeating Character in Stream
challenges.description: Given a stream of lowercase characters, after each char print first non-repeating so far, else -1. Use queue + freq array.
challenges.starterCode: // push to queue, check front until freq==1

challenges.title: Queue Using Two Stacks
challenges.description: Implement queue where enqueue pushes to stack1 and dequeue pops from stack2 (transfer when needed). Print final queue elements.

challenges.title: Remove Consecutive Duplicates
challenges.description: Given a string, repeatedly remove adjacent duplicate pairs using stack. Return final string.
challenges.starterCode: // push characters, if stack top matches pop else push
